actions.committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported.
Reported by the Committee on Education and Labor. H. Rept. 101-2.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 4.
Mr. Williams moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
The chair announced that a second on the motion to suspend the rules is not required.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 24. By unanimous consent.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Amendment SP 63 proposed by Senator Mitchell for Senator Pell.
Amendment SP 63 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.
Mr. Williams asked unanimous consent that the House agree to the Senate amendment.
On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Cleared for White House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 101-26.

official_title: To make a correction in the Education and Training for a Competitive America Act of 1988.

summary.text: Directs the Secretaries of Agriculture and of the Interior, subject to specified conditions, to take all actions necessary to effect the conveyance of certain Federal lands in the State of Washington in exchange for specified privately-owned lands. Provides that conveyance of Okanogan National Forest lands shall be done by the Secretary of Agriculture (Secretary). Permits the Secretary to request the Secretary of the Interior to convey public lands as may be required in order to complete such exchange. Requires the Secretary to analyze the exchange and issue a record of decision by October 1, 1991. Sets November 1, 1991, as the date by which such exchange should be completed. Prohibits conveyance of Federal lands as part of the exchange if certain requirements are not met. Adds lands acquired by the United States under this Act to the National Forest System. Establishes procedures for administrative and judicial review of this Act. Authorizes appropriations for the Forest Service to prepare the Supplement to the Final Environmental Impact Statement for the proposed Early Winters Resort (EWR) in Methow Valley, Washington.

titles.title: To make a correction in the Education and Training for a Competitive America Act of 1988.
